page.title: 19Oystermouth - Old Mumbles
page.content: Mumbles is not really a village nor is it a town but a group of small communities huddled together on the West side of Swansea Bay. At the centre of the group which includes Norton, Newton, Langland and Thistleboon is Oystermouth which grew up around the Norman Castle. The first Castle was built by the de Breos family at the end of the 12th Century. It was made of wood but this was not secure enough when attacked by the native Welsh, so the present stone one was built. In the last century Mumbles was a fishing village and on the beach there were farms where oysters were grown. It was, and still is such a beautiful place that people travel many miles to come and see it. By Robert Evans
